definition: The word "heraus" refers to the action of moving something or someone from an enclosed or hidden position to a visible or accessible one. It is commonly used in contexts where objects or individuals are being brought out, extracted, or released from a specific location or situation.

examples.german: Sie fand heraus, dass er gelogen hatte.
examples.english: She found out that he had lied.

examples.german: Der Hund sprang aus dem Auto heraus.
examples.english: The dog jumped out of the car.

examples.german: Er schaute heraus, um zu sehen, wer gekommen war.
examples.english: He looked out to see who had come.

examples.german: Sie nahm das Buch aus dem Regal heraus.
examples.english: She took the book out of the shelf.
